content.text:
# List of wars involving Kuwait

This is a list of wars involving the State of Kuwait  and its predecessor states.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! colspan="1" rowspan="2" style="background:#AAA" width="120" " | Conflict
! colspan="1" rowspan="2" style="background:#AAA" width="140" | Kuwaitand allies

|Battle of Chains (629 or 633) (part of Muslim conquest of Mesopotamia)
|Rashidun Caliphate
| Sasanian Empire
|Rashidun Caliphate victory
|
|
|
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Utbi Invasion of Bahrain(1782–1783)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Zubarah
| style="background:#efefef" |  Persia
*Bushehr
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Naval attack by the Bushehri navy on Zubarah in 1782 fails.
*Civil war starts in Bahrain after the attack on Zubarah.
*Jidhafs win the civil war, however, by this time the Zubarans had just entered the country.
*Zubarah gains control of Bahrain in 1783
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
| rowspan="4" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Battle of Al-Raqah(1783)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait
| style="background:#efefef" |  Banu Kaab
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Kuwaiti victory over Banu Kaab.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Ibn Ufaisan's Invasion(1793)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Great Britain
* British East India Company
| style="background:#efefef" |  Emirate of Diriyah
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Saudi retreat from Kuwait.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Battle of Khakeekera(1811)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Bahrain
| style="background:#efefef" |  Emirate of Diriyah
*Dammam
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Rahmah ibn Jabir al-Jalahimah's invasion of Bahrain repelled.
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Sheikh Humoud's Revolt  (1828)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Ottoman Empire
*Baghdad Eyalet
| style="background:#efefef" | Arab tribes
* Al-Muntafiq
* Banu Kaab
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Kuwaiti intervention in Basra leads to ceasefire with the Bani Kaab.
*Sheikh Humoud imprisoned by Governor of Baghdad Dawud Pasha and replaced by his nephew Sheikh Aqeel as Emir of the Muntafiq tribal confederation.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
| rowspan="4" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Siege of Basra(1831)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Arab tribes
* Banu Kaab
* Al-Muntafiq
| style="background:#efefef" |  Ottoman Empire
*Baghdad Eyalet
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*End of several week long siege of Basra by the allies of former Baghdad governor Dawud Pasha.
*Arab demands met with the Re-installation of Aziz Agha as Mutasallim of Basra.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Siege of Al-Zubair(1833)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait House of Al Thaqib Arab tribes
* Al-Muntafiq
| style="background:#efefef" | Zubair
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*End of the seven-month-long siege of Zubair.
*Restoration of the Al Thaqib family as the ruling house of Zubair.
*Massacre of the House of Al Zuhair by the reinstated House of Al Thaqib; survivors find refuge in Kuwait and Ottoman Iraq.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Invasion of Muhammara(1837)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Ottoman Empire
*Baghdad Eyalet
| style="background:#efefef" |  Banu Kaab
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Capture and destruction of Muhammara (Khorramshahr) by Ali Rida Pasha, Governor of Baghdad.
*Banu Kaab pays homage to the Ottomans rather than the Persians.
*Kuwait wins alliance with the Ottoman Empire and becomes unrivaled in sharing with Basra the commercial prosperity in the northern region of the Gulf with the fall of Muhammara.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Al-Hasa Expedition(1870–1871)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Ottoman Empire Arab tribes
| style="background:#efefef" |  Emirate of Nejd
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Al Hasa is reincorporated into the Ottoman Empire and becomes known as the Najd Sanjak.
*Sheikh Abdullah bin Sabah Al Sabah the ruler of Kuwait is granted the honorific title of Kaymakam by the Ottomans for his contribution to the war effort.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Kuwaiti–Rashidi War(1900-1901)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait
| style="background:#efefef" |  Jabal Shammar
| style="background:#E0D0FF" | Inconclusive
*Kuwaiti Invasion of Najd repelled.
*Jabal Shammar Counter-Invasion Fails
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
| rowspan="4" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Battle of Jo-Laban(1903)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait
| style="background:#efefef" |  Jabal Shammar
*Mutayr
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Five thousand camels captured as booty.
*Beginning of Saudi-Rashidi War.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Battle of Hadia(1910)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait
| style="background:#efefef" | Al-Muntafiq
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Kuwaiti-Saudi initial defeat at the Battle of Hadia.
*Sheikh Mubarak sends another force which easily claims victory against the Al Muntafiq tribe.
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Mesopotamian Campaign  (1914–1918)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait (1914) British Empire
* Australia
*
* New Zealand
| style="background:#efefef" |  German Empire
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
Kuwaiti Front:
*Ottoman forces expelled from their positions in Umm Qasr, Safwan, and Bubiyan.
*British public recognition of Kuwait as a protectorate proclaiming it to be an “independent government under British protection.
British Front:
*Treaty of Sèvres
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Kuwait–Najd War(1919–1920)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait
| style="background:#efefef" |  Emirate of Nejd and Hasa
* Ikhwan
| style="background:#E0D0FF" | Kuwaiti Military victory, Najdi Political Victory
*Uqair Protocol of 1922
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Ikhwan Revolt(1927–1930)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Sheikhdom of Kuwait Nejd and Hejaz United Kingdom
*RAF
| style="background:#efefef" |  Ikhwan
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
*Ikhwan attack on Kuwait repelled.
*The remnants of the Ikhwan incorporated into regular Saudi units.
*The Ikhwan leadership was either slain or imprisoned.
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" | }}
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Operation Vantage  (1961-1963)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Saudi Arabia Sudan
| style="background:#efefef" |  Iraq
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Mission success
* The crisis ended after the military coup against Abdul Karim Qasim and his execution.
* Saudi Arabia forces were sent to Kuwait consisting of 1,281 Saudi soldiers.
.
| colspan="2" style="background:#efefef" |
| style="background:#efefef" |
|-
| style="background:#efefef" | Al-Samita border skirmish(1973)
| style="background:#efefef" |  Kuwait
| style="background:#efefef" |  Iraq
| style="background:#E0D0FF" | Ceasefire
*Pull back of Iraqi Armed Forces to the demarcation line set by the Arab League during Operation Vantage 1961.
*Iraqi withdrawal from Al-Samita border post under Saudi pressure.

| style="background:#F88" | Defeat
* At the final ceasefire:
** Egyptian forces held  on the eastern bank of the canal.
** Israeli forces held  on the western bank of the canal.
** Israeli forces held  of the Syrian Bashan region of the Golan Heights.
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
| colspan="1" style="background:#efefef" |
|-
|Invasion of Kuwait(1990)(part of the Gulf War)
|
|
Iraq
| style="background:#F88" | Iraqi victory
* UNSC Resolution 660 condemns invasion on 2 August
* UNSC Resolution 661 imposes international sanctions against Iraq and declares Kuwait's right to self-defence on 6 August
* UNSC Resolution 662 designates Iraqi occupation/annexation of Kuwait as illegal on 9 August
* UNSC Resolution 665 authorizes naval blockade against Iraq on 25 August
*Iraq establishes the "Republic of Kuwait" on 2 August and annexes it on 28 August
** Northern Kuwait becomes the Saddamiyat al-Mitla' District within Iraq's Basra Governorate
** Southern Kuwait becomes Iraq's Kuwait Governorate
